p: The aim of this work is to relate the chemical composition of Lithuanian marsh rosemary ( Rh. tomentosum H. at various vegetative stages) essential oils to their toxic ( Artemia sera larvae lethality test), radical scavenging ABTS • + (2,2′-amino-bis(ethylbenzothiazoline-6-sulfonic acid) diammonium salt), DPPH • (2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl), and TROLOX (6-hydroxy-2,5,7,8-tetra-methylchromane-2-carboxylic acid) equivalent assay) and antifungal (against pathogenic Candida parapsilosis and model organism unicellular fungus Saccharomyces cerevisiae) activities.
